key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA prices are consistently higher, observed in over 98% of cases compared to Ethiopian Airlines' website.
MSE channel maintains strong price parity with the airlineâ€™s direct site, exhibiting negligible price discrepancies.
GDS displays higher pricing than the airline's website consistently, with over 99% frequency.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Ethiopian Airlines prices on OTA are consistently higher, with OTA Higher status observed in nearly 99% of the cases.
Website offers are rarely missing from OTA, noted at just about 1% of the instances.
The average price uplift for OTA is steady around 0.63% to 0.65% across different timescales.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In over 98% of the analyzed cases, OTA prices exceed those on the Ethiopian Airlines website.
Only about 1% of offers are missing from the OTA channel.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: For short haul, OTA prices are mostly higher, following the overall trend with a consistent price difference.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA pricing patterns from Ethiopian origins mirror the overall trend, with the OTA channel frequently pricing higher.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in booking shows a slight increase in OTA higher pricing frequency, yet the price difference remains around 0.63%.
Far-out bookings show stability in OTA higher pricing, but the status remains overwhelmingly in favor of higher OTA prices.

mse_highlights.line_content: Across all dimensions and booking windows, MSE prices were consistently the same as the airline's direct site, with negligible differences in offer availability.
There were no significant instances where MSE prices were higher or lower than the airline's direct prices, reinforcing pricing synchronization.
The presence of the airline's offers on MSE closely mirrored their availability over the past weeks and month, with no significant fluctuations.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: A small fraction (0.4%) of offers were not present on MSE compared to the airline's site, with a slight improvement from previous measurements.
Nearly all analyzed routes showed no price differences between MSE and the airline site, indicating strong price parity maintenance.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: For Short Haul routes, MSE prices matched the airline's site 100% of the time, maintaining uniformity across periods with no observed cases of higher or lower MSE pricing.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: From Ethiopian origins, the channel maintained consistent parity with the airline site, showing a persistent absence of pricing discrepancies across all data points.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-In bookings consistently reflected the airline's site prices, with full parity maintained over time.
Far-Out itineraries exhibited slight variations in offer availability but remained consistent in pricing accuracy with the airline site.

gds_highlights.line_content: In all relevant categories, GDS prices were consistently higher than those on the airline website, with over 99% frequency last week.
The pattern of GDS having higher prices has been stable across the last week, previous week, and month, with only minor fluctuations.
Across all dimensions and time comparisons, there were no instances recorded where the GDS channel offered lower prices than the website.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The GDS consistently offered higher prices, with frequency close to or at 100% across time frames.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: On short-haul routes, GDS pricing was always higher, with minimal variation in the frequency observed.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating from Ethiopia showed GDS pricing higher than the website nearly universally, reflecting the broader channel trend.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings frequently had higher prices on GDS, with little to no variation over time.
Bookings made far ahead also showed nearly universal higher pricing on GDS, maintaining steady rates over the observed months.
